com.flowpowered.react.math

Class Transform

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.react.math.Transform

  • public class Transform
extends Object
    Represents a position and an orientation in 3D. It can also be seen as representing a translation and a rotation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transform()
      Default constructor.
      Transform(Transform transform)
      Copy constructor.
      Transform(Vector3 position, Matrix3x3 orientation)
      Constructs a new transform from the position as a vector3 and the orientation as a 3x3 matrix.
      Transform(Vector3 position, Quaternion orientation)
      Constructs a new transform from the position as a vector3 and the orientation as a quaternion.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object obj) 
      Transform getInverse()
      Inverses the rotation and position of this transform and returns it as a new one.

      Gets the orientation component of this transform as a quaternion.
      Vector3 getPosition()
      Gets the position component of this transform as a vector3.
      int hashCode() 
      static Transform identity()
      Returns a new identity transform.
      static Transform interpolateTransforms(Transform transform1, Transform transform2, float percent)
      Interpolates a transform between two other.
      static Transform multiply(Transform transform1, Transform transform2)
      Multiplies the first transform by the second one and returns the result as a new transform.
      static Vector3 multiply(Transform transform, Vector3 vector)
      Multiplies the transform by a vector3 and returns the result as a new vector3.
      Transform set(Transform transform)
      Sets the position and orientation of this transform to those of the provided transform.
      void setOrientation(Quaternion orientation)
      Sets the orientation component of this transform to the desired quaternion.
      void setPosition(Vector3 position)
      Sets the position component of this transform to the desired vector3.
      void setToIdentity()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transform

        public Transform()
        Default constructor. Position will be the zero vector and the rotation, quaternion identity.

                 Matrix3x3 orientation)

        orientation - The orientation

      • getPosition

        public Vector3 getPosition()
        Gets the position component of this transform as a vector3.
        Returns:
        The position

      • getOrientation

        public Quaternion getOrientation()
        Gets the orientation component of this transform as a quaternion.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vector3 position)
        Sets the position component of this transform to the desired vector3.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to set

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(Quaternion orientation)
        Sets the orientation component of this transform to the desired quaternion.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The position to set

      • set

        public Transform set(Transform transform)
        Sets the position and orientation of this transform to those of the provided transform.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to copy the position and orientation from

      • setToIdentity

        public void setToIdentity()
        Sets this transform to identity. The vector is set to the zero vector, and the quaternion, to the identity quaternion.

      • getInverse

        public Transform getInverse()
        Inverses the rotation and position of this transform and returns it as a new one.
        Returns:
        The transform which is the inverse of this one

        Overrides:

      • identity

        public static Transform identity()
        Returns a new identity transform. That is, a transform with the position as the zero vector and the orientation as the identity quaternion.
        Returns:
        A new identity transform

      • multiply

        public static Vector3 multiply(Transform transform,
                               Vector3 vector)
        Multiplies the transform by a vector3 and returns the result as a new vector3.
        Parameters:

        vector - The vector
        Returns:

      • multiply

        public static Transform multiply(Transform transform1,
                                 Transform transform2)
        Multiplies the first transform by the second one and returns the result as a new transform.
        Parameters:
        transform1 - The first transform
        transform2 - The second transform
        Returns:

      • interpolateTransforms

        public static Transform interpolateTransforms(Transform transform1,
                                              Transform transform2,
                                              float percent)
        Interpolates a transform between two other.
        Parameters:
        transform1 - The first transform
        transform2 - The second transform
        percent - The percent for the interpolation, between 0 and 1 inclusively
        Returns:
        The interpolated transform
